name: iTraff  Technology
tag_list: mobile, photo-recognition, technology, polish, image-recognition-technology, applications, smartphone, iphone, android
overview:
iTraff Technology is a company that was founded in 2010 and offers image recognition technology. The value of the global market which uses this technology is worth a total of U.S. $4.3 billion, of which more than U.S. $972 million is generated in the U.S. market.

At the seed stage of financing iTraff Technology received, at the beginning of 2011, U.S. $310 000 from VC fund SpeedUp. A year later, in the early 2012, in the first round of funding, the company has received nearly twice as much, U.S. $559 000 from 4 European investors. The acquired funds are spent primarily on the development of the main product, the API platform: www.Recognize.im

Recognize.im platform allows to quickly build your own application that uses image recognition technology. All you have to do after signing up is to upload or import your own graphics to the server, and then download and compile the complete, ready to use code from the site. This type of solution allows for increase of both user engagement and sales through the mobile channel.

So far technology developed by iTraff technology has enabled the creation of many applications in the fields of e-commerce, publishing, advertising, or affiliated with major brands. Partnership projects are carried out with companies like Evernote or Facebook.

The company has also collected a number of awards for its implementations, including competitions in the United States, Austria, Finland, Greece, Poland and Belgium (including the prize awarded by the European Commission Commissioner for the Digital Agenda, Neelie Kroes).
